page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: And Gymnastics Club. Carnegie Drive at the Bus Station is another reminder of his name. During the Summer there is a Gala Day set up by the Carnegie Trust. Gala Day includes a big procession with all the Primary School children wlking down from the Public Park through the High Street to Pittencrieff Glen. Then there is a picnic and games in the Glen. The name Carnegie brings many tourists, especially Americans, to Dunfermline to visit his home and the Carnegie Museum. Dunfermline was once the Capital of Scotland, and there is an old palace and monastery. Scottish Kings were buried here, the most famous being King Robert the Bruce, whose name is part of the stonework of the Abbey Tower.
